title: Uncut opal

properties.value: An uncut opal is a members only item, classified as a type of semi-precious gem in RuneScape. Uncut opals can be cut with a chisel resulting in an opal or a crushed gem. Successfully cutting an opal grants the player 15 Crafting experience, smashing grants 3.8. Opals are the lowest level gemstone, the most common, and are worth very little.

Item ID1625

An uncut opal is a members only item, classified as a type of semi-precious gem in RuneScape. Uncut opals can be cut with a chisel resulting in an opal or a crushed gem. Successfully cutting an opal grants the player 15 Crafting experience, smashing grants 3.8. Opals are the lowest level gemstone, the most common, and are worth very little.

Opals are found mostly with the Mining skill, only by mining gem rocks which are located in Shilo Village and the Lunar Isle mine. Uncut opals can also be found while panning at the Digsite near the River Salve, or they may be stolen from H.A.M members via the Thieving skill. There is usually a high supply of these items on the market, so trading with another player will also quickly produce them.

Contents

  • 1 Processing and uses
  • 2 Cutting chance
  • 3 Products
  • 4 Item sources
    • 4.1 Shop locations
  • 5 Changes
    • 5.1 Gallery (historical)
  • 6 References

Processing and uses[edit | edit source]

Opals are sometimes used in bulk to train Crafting, but this is slow. When cutting opals, many of the gems get accidentally crushed into a crushed gem. This continues to happen commonly even at high levels, resulting in only 3.8 Crafting experience. Opals can be smelted with silver bars to create opal jewellery. Using the chisel on an already cut opal will make 12 opal bolt tips (this operation will never smash a gem) and gives the player 1.5 Fletching experience per gem. Opal tips are used to tip bronze bolts which can then be enchanted.

Cutting chance[edit | edit source]

The chance to successfully cut an opal is: ( level − 1 ) ∗ 122 / 98 + 129 256 {\displaystyle {\frac {({\text{level}}-1)*122/98+129}{256}}} [1]

Based on this probability formula, the price of uncut opal 377, and the price of opal 615, the minimum crafting level to breakeven or better when flipping opals is 24.

{{External|rs|rsc}} {{Infobox Item |name = Uncut opal |image = [[File:Uncut opal.png]] |release = [[27 January]] [[2003]] |update = Shilo Village Quest online |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = Yes |placeholder = Yes |equipable = No |stackable = No |noteable = Yes |destroy = Drop |examine = This would be worth more cut. |value = 20 |weight = 0.003 |exchange = Yes |id = 1625 }} [[File:Uncut opal detail.png|left|130px]] An '''uncut opal''' is a members only item, classified as a type of semi-precious gem in ''[[RuneScape]]''. Uncut opals can be cut with a [[chisel]] resulting in an [[opal]] or a [[crushed gem]]. Successfully cutting an opal grants the player 15 [[Crafting]] [[experience]], smashing grants 3.8. Opals are the lowest level gemstone, the most common, and are worth very little. Opals are found mostly with the [[Mining]] skill, only by mining [[gem rocks]] which are located in [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]] and the [[Lunar Isle mine]]. Uncut opals can also be found while panning at the [[Digsite]] near the [[River Salve]], or they may be stolen from [[Humans Against Monsters|H.A.M]] members via the [[Thieving]] skill. There is usually a high supply of these items on the market, so trading with another player will also quickly produce them. ==Processing and uses== Opals are sometimes used in bulk to train Crafting, but this is slow. When cutting opals, many of the gems get accidentally crushed into a [[crushed gem]]. This continues to happen commonly even at high levels, resulting in only 3.8 Crafting experience. Opals can be smelted with silver bars to create opal jewellery. Using the chisel on an already cut opal will make 12 [[opal bolt tips]] (this operation will never smash a gem) and gives the player 1.5 [[Fletching]] experience per gem. Opal tips are used to tip bronze bolts which can then be enchanted. ==Cutting chance== The chance to successfully cut an opal is: \frac{(\text{level}-1)*122/98+129}{256}{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1084600993038389248|date=13 January 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.fo/HYHsC|archivedate=14 June 2019}} {{Skilling success chart|label=Gem cutting rates |label1=Opal|low1=128|high1=250|req1=1|color1=gray|image1=Opal.png |label2=Jade|low2=100|high2=245|req2=13|color2=green|image2=Jade.png |label3=Red topaz|low3=90|high3=240|req3=16|color3=pink|image3=Red topaz.png }} Based on this probability formula, the price of uncut opal {{Coins|{{GEP|Uncut opal}}}}, and the price of opal {{Coins|{{GEP|Opal}}}}, the minimum crafting level to breakeven or better when flipping opals is {{GemBreakeven | uncut = {{GEP|Uncut opal}} | cut = {{GEP|Opal}} | r = 1.2448979592 | beta = 129 | gamma = 256}}. ==Products== {{Uses material list|Uncut opal}} ==Item sources== {{Drop sources|Uncut opal}} ===Shop locations=== {{Store locations list|Uncut opal}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 24 July 2007 |update = King's Ransom |change = The item was graphically updated. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ===Gallery (historical)=== {|style="text-align: center" cellpadding="15" |[[File:Uncut opal detail (beta).png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Uncut opal detail (historical).png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Uncut opal detail.png|center|300x150px]] |- |[[File:Uncut opal (beta).png|center]] |[[File:Uncut opal (historical).png|center]] |[[File:Uncut opal.png|center]] |- |RuneScape 2
